contents.Text: [[[underline:Soft Purple]]] ≈ Yt-dlp args
[[[underline:Soft Yellow]]] ≈ Cache
[[[underline:Dark Blue]]] ≈ Dependencies
[[[underline:Light Green]]] ≈ Config location
[[[underline:Pale Orange]]] ≈ Irreversible actions
This is where the download arguments are stored refer to the[[[button:Yt-dlp page][../../../Downloader/Playlist Editor/YT_dlp_args]]]for more info on args
In the above image
•Soft Purple: Button/Heading to select what arguments you want to edit (left click to edit | right click to deselect)
•Soft Yellow: Displays the arguments currently selected for editing in a editor
•Dark Blue: save the current state of the arguments, close the argument editing window, or remove the selected argument entirely.
This involves actions to the downloader cache
•Graveyard Cache: This is where dead/broken links are stored to never be used again
•Graveyard Temp: This holds links that have failed but not failed enough to qualify to be merged into "Graveyard Cache"
Both buttons clear their respective caches forcing re-downloads of failed or potentially failed urls
Warning: You probably don't want to do this unless you tried to download offline
as downloading offline would make all downloads fail this false positives are added in here

TextCustom.content: if you do clear "Graveyard Cache" expect a large amount of urls attempting to be downloaded

contents.Text: •Clear Cache: This Clears all previously downloaded URLs, effectively resetting the downloader
This forces all successful URLs to be downloaded again. Use only if a complete reset is necessary
This forces Yt-dlp to be updated on next launch of RhythmiRust
This is done once a week automatically but if a emergency update is pushed to Yt-dlp
You can use this to get updated right away
This moves the config from being portable to global stored locations are:
Windows: localappdata\RhythmiRust
Linux: ~/.config/RhythmiRust
This as actions for mass deletion (Warning: These actions are final and cannot be reversed)
Prune History for Dead Searches: This will search each thing in "History" and if the search is empty remove it from history
Clear History: This will full remove everything from history
